### 1. Create multiple directories

```{bash eval=FALSE}
for i in {1..6}; do
  for j in {1..5}; do
    for k in {1..10}; do
      for z in 0.00100 0.00200 0.00300 0.00400 0.00500 0.00600 0.00700 0.00800; do
        mkdir -p network_$i/CV_$j/layer_$k/lr_$z
      done
    done
  done
done
```

or

```{bash eval=FALSE}
mkdir -p network_1/{CV_1,CV_2,CV_3,done}
```


### 2. Create multiple files

#### Step 1. Create A Dir
```{bash eval=FALSE}
mkdir file
```



#### Step 2. Move to Dir 

```{bash eval=FALSE}
cd file/
```

#### Step 3. Create 100 python file

```{bash eval=FALSE}
touch Name{0001..0100}.py
```


### 3. Write some contents into multiple files

#### Step 1. Create Some files as 1

#### Step 2. Write a for loop

```{bash eval=FALSE}
cat >> yourfile.sh << EOL
line 1 content
line 2 content
line 3 content
EOL
```


#### For example
bash write_into_file.sh
```{bash eval=FALSE}
J=1
for i in *.py
do
	echo $i;

	J=$(printf '%04d' $J) 
	cat >> $i << EOL
#!/bin/bash /home/liyt/
#$ -S /bin/bash
#$ -j y
#$ -cwd

#BSUB -J liyt_Job     #LSF job name
#BSUB -q cceb_normal

module switch python/2.7.10 python/3.5.2

python  Linux_$J.py > results_$J.txt

EOL

	J=`echo $J+1 | bc`

done
```


#### Perl
```{bash eval=FALSE}
@list = (1..100);

foreach my $i (@list){
    my $i = sprintf ("%04d", $i);
    system "bsub sh name_$i\.sh";
    #print "$i\n";
}
```

### 3. Edit one line in multiple files

```{bash eval=FALSE}
for i in *.py; do
    sed -i -e 's/old_string/new_string/g' $i
done
```
